benchmark_details.name: OmniThought
benchmark_details.overview: OmniThought is a large-scale dataset featuring 2 million Chain-of-Thought (CoT) processes generated and validated by two powerful LRMs as teacher models, annotated with Reasoning Verbosity and Cognitive Difficulty scores.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the development and training of large reasoning models for solving complex tasks through a comprehensive dataset of CoT processes.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The dataset has a limited scope of reasoning tasks and a static construction process.

data.source: Sourced from established datasets like OpenThoughts2-1M and DeepMath-103K.
data.annotation: Automatically generated and validated by LRMs with Reasoning Verbosity and Cognitive Difficulty scores.

methodology.calculation: RV and CD scores are calculated based on model evaluations and token counts normalized against dataset characteristics.
methodology.interpretation: Scores indicate the appropriateness of CoT verbosity and cognitive difficulty level for optimal LRM training.
methodology.validation: Extensive benchmarking using Qwen2.5 models demonstrates improved training effectiveness.
